comments:
05/19 integration build.

Was trying to understand the logic on the About product dialog that determined 
when features icon's should appear.  When adding an alternate branding (WSWB) I 
could not get the WSWB 32x32 gif to appear on the about dialog.  

Was confused as  two different eclipse icons would appear when the WSWB brand 
was the primary feature. (This is because the gif in the pde plugin is fuzzy 
when compared with the other eclipse plugins - so the dialog views them as 
different).  

Figured out that the active feature icon is not shown in the 32x32 icon area 
even when other features with the same 32x32 icons exist.  Wonder if this is the 
desired behavior.

As part of debugging this I tried two things:

Load the UI plugin into the workspace, launch a runtime instance of the 
workbench, and then trace through the about dialog code using breakpoints to 
study areas of interest.  This occurred during this process:
- Error parsing version "null" for plugin: com.ibm.wswb.sdk in 
workbench.readFeaturesInfo()
- The about product dialog does not include any 32x32 gifs and the about 
features dialog does not include any content.
Copy the .options file from the UI plugin to the root directory and launch 
eclipse with -debug -consolelog.  This occurred during this process:

- If run from the base -5/19 eclipse unzip - nothing unusual occurs.
- If run from a base that has been tweaked to use an alternate primary feature 
(WSWB) the following entries exist in the console window:
------------

------------

Not sure if there is something I'm missing or if the dir names (_2.0.0) in the 
runtime plugin dir - no _2.0.0 in the workspace project) have anything to do 
with this problem.

The about dialog should work the same under debug as when running as host.

Will ask PDE to fix up their icon.

In 2.0 the feature icons in the about dialog are feature provider icons.
An icon is shown for each provider. More than one icon will be shown for a 
provider if the provider's features specify icons with a different name or CRC.
The primary feature's icon is not excluded (this went in late in 2.0).

Note when testing this in a runtime the -update command line argument should 
be used (the the target has already been run you must also delete the contents 
of its .config directory). This will cause the features to appear in the 
target. This is a workaround for an Install/PDE issue.

Please reopen if any further problems are encountered.

traces.message: Can't find resource for bundle  java.util.PropertyResourceBundle, key appName
